greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of bases B (2 <= B <= n) such that every digit of n in base B is 0 or 1.
comment: All such bases are divisors of n or n-1, since the lowest base-B digit of n is 0 iff B | n, 1 iff B | n-1. - _Robert Israel_, Jul 04 2018
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: nops(select(b -> convert(convert(n,base,b),set) subset {0,1}, {$2..n} intersect (numtheory:-divisors(n) union numtheory:-divisors(n-1)))):
program: (PARI) a(n) = sum(b=2, n, #select(x->(x>1), digits(n, b)) == 0); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 04 2018
results.author: _Dean Hickerson_, Mar 31 2002
